title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.  Steps To Reproduce:  1. Start WSWB and create a new project.  2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.  3. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down" command to shut down/reboot the computer.
EB: Expectation: There should be a warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty file(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR: 1. Start WSWB and create a new project.  2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.  3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.  4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down" command to shut down/reboot the computer.  5. Verify that a warning or question message box is displayed, giving users a chance to save their dirty file(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
